<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/588d241d44fc25ad4c5a635ee4fdeafdfcee0fde|patch 8.2.1792: Configure does not recognize Racket 6.1+>
patch 8.2.1792: Configure does not recognize Racket 6.1+

Problem:    Configure does not recognize Racket 6.1+.
Solution:   Add a check for "rktio". (closes #7062)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1792: Configure does not recognize Racket 6.1+ · vim/vim@588d241
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1792: Configure does not recognize Racket 6.1+ · vim/vim@588d241
attachments.text: Problem: Configure does not recognize Racket 6.1+. Solution: Add a check for "rktio". (closes #7062)

patch 8.2.1791: Vim9: debugger test fails

Problem:    Vim9: debugger test fails.
Solution:   Use "var" instead of "let".

attachments.title: patch 8.2.1791: Vim9: debugger test fails · vim/vim@1bdae40
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: debugger test fails. Solution: Use "var" instead of "let".

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/794771cfd83af2a0d1926bed301e784447e7290b|patch 8.2.1790: MS-Windows with Python: crash when executed from Vifm>
patch 8.2.1790: MS-Windows with Python: crash when executed from Vifm

Problem:    MS-Windows with Python: crash when executed from Vifm.
Solution:   Use NUL instead of CONIN. (Ken Takata, closes #7061, closes #7053)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1790: MS-Windows with Python: crash when executed from Vifm · vim/vim@794771c
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1790: MS-Windows with Python: crash when executed from Vifm · vim/vim@794771c
attachments.text: Problem: MS-Windows with Python: crash when executed from Vifm. Solution: Use NUL instead of CONIN. (Ken Takata, closes #7061, closes #7053)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c1f0066b642fb62e37b300033223ff3ee4aafcd6|patch 8.2.1789: Vim9: crash with invalid list constant>
patch 8.2.1789: Vim9: crash with invalid list constant

Problem:    Vim9: crash with invalid list constant. (Dhiraj Mishra)
Solution:   Return FAIL when compiling the list fails. (closes #7066)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1789: Vim9: crash with invalid list constant · vim/vim@c1f0066
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1789: Vim9: crash with invalid list constant · vim/vim@c1f0066
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: crash with invalid list constant. (Dhiraj Mishra) Solution: Return FAIL when compiling the list fails. (closes #7066)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/016faaa1b2fe242022725b29e1353c42105d045c|patch 8.2.1788: Vim9: still allows :let for declarations>
patch 8.2.1788: Vim9: still allows :let for declarations

Problem:    Vim9: still allows :let for declarations.
Solution:   Make the default for v:disallow_let one.  It can still be set to
            zero to allow for using :let.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1788: Vim9: still allows :let for declarations · vim/vim@016faaa
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1788: Vim9: still allows :let for declarations · vim/vim@016faaa
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: still allows :let for declarations. Solution: Make the default for v:disallow_let one. It can still be set to zero to allow for using :let.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/795aaa1e84d76a6fe066694de9876b8a21cbe40c|patch 8.2.1787: crash with 'incsearch' and very long line>
patch 8.2.1787: crash with 'incsearch' and very long line

Problem:    Crash with 'incsearch' and very long line.
Solution:   Check whether regprog becomes NULL. (closes #7063)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1787: crash with 'incsearch' and very long line · vim/vim@795aaa1
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1787: crash with 'incsearch' and very long line · vim/vim@795aaa1
attachments.text: Problem: Crash with 'incsearch' and very long line. Solution: Check whether regprog becomes NULL. (closes #7063)

patch 8.2.1786: various Normal mode commands not fully tested

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/3f974ff45e0ea4b85fea7d8768f005d8a2c7941e|patch 8.2.1785: compiler warning for strcp() out of bounds>
patch 8.2.1785: compiler warning for strcp() out of bounds

Problem:    Compiler warning for strcp() out of bounds. (Christian Brabandt)
Solution:   use memmove() instead.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1785: compiler warning for strcp() out of bounds · vim/vim@3f974ff
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1785: compiler warning for strcp() out of bounds · vim/vim@3f974ff
attachments.text: Problem: Compiler warning for strcp() out of bounds. (Christian Brabandt) Solution: use memmove() instead.
